Rule_Text: Medical expenses exceeding 7.5% of income may be deductible.
Office supplies are fully deductible when used for business purposes.
Travel expenses, including airfare and lodging, are deductible if they are business-related.
Meals are generally 50% deductible, except for special circumstances.
Rent expenses for business premises are fully deductible.
Utilities expenses can be deducted as business operating costs.
Entertainment expenses are subject to a 50% deduction limit.
Miscellaneous expenses must be directly related to business activities to be deductible.
Payments to independent contractors (contract labor) are fully deductible as business expenses.
Advertising and marketing costs, including digital ads and printed materials, are fully deductible.
Business insurance premiums, such as liability or property coverage, are fully deductible.
Fees for professional services, such as legal or accounting, are deductible as business expenses.
Software purchases and cloud-based subscriptions used for business are deductible.
Bank fees, transaction charges, and interest on business loans are deductible business expenses.
